subject: Kentucky Derby
Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Winning Colors, the 1988 Kentucky Derby winner, was euthanized Sunday after a bout with colic and was buried at Greentree Farm, according to the Gainesway thoroughbred farm in Lexington, Ky. She was 23. Winning Colors is one of three fillies to win the Derby. The others are Regret in 1915 and Genuine Risk in 1980. As a 3-year-old, Winning Colors won the Derby in wire-to-wire fashion under Gary Stevens, defeating Forty Niner. She also won the Grade I Santa Anita Derby and the Santa Anita Oaks that year and finished with eight wins, three seconds and a third.
